summary: pentacyclic triterpenoid compounds oleanolic acid (OA) and glycyrrhetinic acid (GA) are distributed widely in nature. the in vitro anticancer activities of new OA and GA derivatives were tested using the combination principle. about 17.5 million cancer cases were detected and 8.7 million deaths occurred in 2015 worldwide. in the u.s., 1,688,780 new cancer cases and 600,920 cancer deaths were projected to occur in 2017. recently developed anticancer drugs with higher inhibitory activity and strong selectivity. some studies have found that OA and GA have a broad inhibitory effect on the growth of many tumor cell lines in vitro. some studies have found that OA and GA have a broad inhibitory effect on the growth of many tumor cell lines in vitro by inducing tumor cell autophagy and apoptosis. OH position of the OA ester and GA ester, and synthesized 20 new OA and GA derivatives, of which 18 new compounds were the target products. we used five cancer cell lines to determine the antitumor activity and human skin fibroblasts (HSF) as a control. the organic phase was washed with water and dried over anhydrous magnesium sulfate, followed by suction filtration and concentration to obtain Compound 2a or 2b (1 mmol) was dissolved in pyridine (5 mL); then anhydrous acetic anhydride (10 mL) was added. this was stirred at room temperature for 24 h. spectroscopic results are consistent with those of 5a,b. cell apoptosis was assayed by using a PE Annexin V Apoptosis Detection Kit I. cells were digested by 0.25% trypsin-EDTA solution, washed twice with cold PBS and stained with Annexin V-PE (5 L) and 7-AAD (5 L) in binding buffer. cells were seeded into six-well plates, cultured in DMEM supplemented with 10% FBS and incubated at 37°C in 5% CO2 for 24 h. the medium was replaced with a medium containing different concentrations of compound 5b (0, 4 and 8 M) for 48 h. the cells were washed twice with cold PBS and examined under a fluorescence microscope. high-resolution-electrospray ionization-mass spectra (HR-ESI-MS) were recorded with a Bruker-400 instrument (400 MHz) using CDCl3 as the solvent. 48%, mp 190.5°C–192.3°C. a-isonicotinoyloxy-11-oxo-olean-12-en-30-oate (3n) white solid yields 48%, mp 190.5°C–192.3°C. 5a,b Compound 2a or 2b (1 mmol) was dissolved in pyridine (5 mL); then, anhydrous acetic anhydride (10 mL) was added, stirred at room temperature for 24 h. spectroscopic results are consistent with those of 5a,b. the tested compounds were dissolved in a suitable amount of dimethyl sulfoxide prior to the experiment to obtain a known concentration of the solution. the cells were placed in 96-well plates and cultured for 24 h at 37°C in the presence of 5% CO2 atmosphere. after 24 h of incubation, the cells were treated with the test compound of various concentrations. apoptosis was assayed by using a PE Annexin V Apoptosis Detection Kit I. cells were digested by 0.25% trypsin-EDTA solution, washed twice with cold PBS and stained with Annexin V-PE (5 L) and 7-AAD (5 L) in binding buffer. after incubation at room temperature for 15 min, cell apoptosis was analyzed. OA derivatives, namely, 3a–g, were synthesized. the esterification of OA at C-28 was performed by treatment with benzyl bromide to produce esters 3a–e using the EDCI/DMAP system. acetylsalicylic acid to form intermediate I was converted to a N-acylpyridinium intermediate by elimination of a phenoxide anion. the hydroxyl moiety of 2a,b was nucleophilically attacked to produce intermediate II, which was neutralized by the in situ formed phenoxide anion. we have attempted to obtain 6a,b and 7a,b by treating 2a,b with acetyl 3-hydroxybenzoic acid and the synthesis of 3h–n. Notes: Reagents and conditions: (d) DMF, BnBr, K2CO3, room temperature; (e) anhydrous DCM, DMAP, EDCI, reflux, room temperature; (f) SOCl2, Et3N, reflux. acid, DMAP, EDCI, reflux, room temperature; DCM, acetyl 4-hydroxybenzoic acid; EDCI, 1-ethyl-(3-(3-dimethylamino) propyl)-carbodiimide hydrochloride. esterified compounds 2a and 2b with benzyl group exhibited relatively high inhibitory activities against MCF-7 cells, Eca-109 cells and HeLa cells. this indicated that the benzyl group introduced in C-28 position of OA or C-30 position of GA was beneficial to improve the inhibitory activity against these cancer cells. compounds 6a and 7a, bearing the same AcO group in different locations, presented a strong inhibitory activity against HeLa cells. the compound with o-AcO substitutions (6a, IC50 11.980.51 M) at an aromatic ring was more active than the compound with p-AcO substitutions (7a, IC50 15.510.73 M). t al43 used the quantitative structure-activity relationship (QSAR) model to predict that compound 5b has a significant inhibitory effect on MCF-7 cells. compounds 6b and 7b also presented strong targeting inhibition of HeLa cells with IC50 values of 7.820.02 and 10.510.62 M. 10.610.37 41.561.26 3g 20.020.91 16.821.31 32.983.88 32.072.80 8.440.26 40.160.98 3h 74.627.21 26.924.09 44.263.30 19.110.83 >100 >100 3i >100 67.352.11 >100 20.291.58 >100 >100 3j 11.462.94 8.100.40 15.032.83 28.241.44 44.471.73 47.042.90 a IC50 is the drug concentration effective in inhibiting 50% of the cell growth measured by MTT method. a pyridine ring with a lower electron density to the 3-OH position of GA benzyl ester could greatly increase its anticancer activity. 5b showed high antiproliferative activity on Hep-G2 cells. it inhibited cell proliferation in a concentration- and time-dependent manner. 50% of Hep-G2 cells died during treatment with 5 M 5b for 48 h. the population of apoptotic cells treated with compound 5b increased remarkably with a dose- and time-dependent relation. the percentages of Annexin V-positive cells were 5.2% for the control group, 11.7% for 4 M and 21.5% for 8 M after 24 h treatment. exposure of Hep-G2 cells to different concentrations of compound 5b for 24 h led to an increase in MDC fluorescent intensity. at 48 h, this increase was maintained, with M=1,224 for 0 M as the control, M=1,760 for 4 M and M=2,480 for 8 M. the GA ester 2b reacts with organic acids (R2OH) in the EDCI/DMAP system to form compounds 3h–l. treatment of nicotinic acid or isonicotinic acid was followed by the addition of triethylamine and 2b as the acid-binding agent. acetylsalicylic acid easily undergo ester exchange reactions. the main product obtained as a result of the interaction of acetylated 4-hydroxybenzoic acid with 2a,b is 5a,b instead of 7a,b. scheme 1. General experimental method for the synthesis of 3a–g. DCM, DMAP, EDCI, acetyl 3-hydroxybenzoic acid, DMAP, EDCI, reflux, room temperature. Abbreviations: dichloromethane; DMAP, N-dimethyl-4-aminopyridine; EDCI, 1-ethyl-(3-dimethylamino) propyl)-carbodiimide hydrochloride. b and 7a,b were evaluated for their in vitro cytotoxicity against SGC-7901, MCF-7, Eca-109, HeLa, Hep-G2 and HSF cells. the parent compounds OA and GA both showed low inhibitory activities against MCF-7 cells, Hep-G2 cells and HSF cells. ligustrazine-oleanolic acid-amino acid derivatives synthesized by Chu et al. The R1 group was 4-(1H-indol-3-yl)butyroxy long-chain-substituted compound (3b, IC50 8.970.13 M), which had a significantly stronger inhibitory activity against Hep-G2 cells than 2-(1H-indol-3-yl)acetoxy short-chain- compound 3l showed the strongest inhibitory activity against HeLa cells with an IC50 value of 4.320.89 M. cytotoxicity of the derivatives obtained by the Schwarz 50% of the cell growth measured by MTT method. a IC50 is the drug concentration effective in inhibiting 50% of the cell growth measured by MTT. a pyridine ring with a lower electron density to the 3-OH position of GA benzyl ester (compounds 3m and 3n) could greatly increase its anticancer activity. the introduction of a carbonyl group with an electron-withdrawing property into the 3-OH position of GA benzyl ester (compound 5b) could greatly improve its anticancer activity. cell apoptosis induced by compound 5b Apoptosis and necrosis are common cellular responses to anticancer drugs. we detected cell apoptosis by Hoechst 33342 apoptotic staining kit. after treatment with different concentrations of compound 5b for 48 h, the nuclei of Hep-G2 cells were stained by Hoechst 33342. apoptosis was detected by Annexin V/7-AAD assay. cells were treated with 0, 4 and 8 M of compound 5b for 24 and 48 h. cells were stained with MDC as the fluorescent probe. compound 3m was the most active anticancer agent against SGC-7901, MCF-7, Eca-109, HeLa, Hep-G2 and HSF cells. compound 5b showed the best cytotoxic effect (IC50, 3.740.18 M), while it showed lower inhibitory activity against normal HSF. compound 3l showed the strongest inhibitory activity against HeLa cells (IC50, 4.320.89 M) it presented low cytotoxicity toward HSF cells (IC50, 79.944.42 M) it may be a potential new anti-Hep-G2 candidate drug.
